content: I have not come across any scientific literature or evidence of a wolf turning vegetarian and eating only plants. wolves are apex predators and their digestive system is specialized for digesting meat. their diet typically consists of herbivorous animals, and they depend on meat as their primary source of nutrition. while wolves may occasionally eat small amounts of vegetation such as fruits, berries, and grasses, this is primarily as a supplemental source of nutrients rather than as a primary food source. therefore, it is highly unlikely that a wolf would turn completely vegetarian and survive on a plant-based diet.
